title.narrative: SOCIAL PROTECTION SYSTEM

description.narrative: Technical Assistance, which contributes to Child Poverty / Public Finance For Children, Social Exclusion â€“ Data And Evidence, Social Protection, Social Protection (Covid), Social Protection And Child Poverty. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2020, children and adolescents, especially the most disadvantaged, benefit from a social protection framework, and monitoring and evaluation systems to improve public policies and social investment and reduce inequity gaps.

related-activity.ref: 0240/A0/05/881 PR 1: SOCIAL INCLUSION & CHILD RIGHT MON

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Technical Assistance

description.narrative: From 2016-2020, UNICEF generated solid evidence and knowledge on child poverty and social protection that contributed to the social protection system’s expansion. UNICEF built fluid policy dialogues with high-level decision makers and supported field strategies to include 32.891 disadvantaged children in the AUH. Public policy recommendations and advocacy contributed to remove barriers towards AUH’s universalization, resulting in the announcement of the inclusion of1 million children without any coverage. Responding to COVID-19, 4 rapid assessments were conducted to provide timely data to inform public policy decision-making. In 2021, collaboration with grassroot CSOs continued, providing food support to over 46,000 children. | Status:Met | As-of Date:28/07/2021

title.narrative: 1.1 National government measurement of child poverty using multidimensional measures

baseline.value: Bienestar y pobreza de ni?as, ni?os y adolescentes en Argentina at national level

actual.value: 2020:Two microsimulations on monetary child poverty, based on official data, to capture the impact of COVID were timely presented in May and July
